CatDescriptText: Edward Goscenski, college student, Carnegie and Stephanie Kerchner, hairdresser, McKees Rocks, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 27, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that labor unions, in general, are doing all they can to see that Negroes are not discriminated against in hiring and upgrading in employment?"  Mr. Goscenski's answer reads: "I believe they are doing a fairly good job.  But, they should try to do a little better."  Mrs. Kerchner's answer reads: "I think so."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Edward Goscenski wearing Pitt jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Stephanie Kerchner wearing dark overcoat with fur collar, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
